```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

Read the data and filter

```{r}
air_data <- read_csv("data/air_data_selected_states.csv", show_col_types = FALSE, guess_max = 9500)
no2_data <- air_data%>%
  filter(`Parameter Name` == "Nitrogen dioxide (NO2)")
```

Convert to spatial points

```{r}
library(sp)
coordinates(no2_data) = ~Longitude+Latitude
```

Plot 
```{r}
plot(no2_data)
```

Make a grid

```{r}
## 1. Create a grid from the values in your points dataframe
## first get the range in data
x.range <- as.integer(range(no2_data@coords[,1]))
y.range <- as.integer(range(no2_data@coords[,2]))
```

```{r}
##2. Create a grid with a slightly larger extent
plot(no2_data)
#use the locator to click 4 points beyond the extent of the plot
#and use those to set your x and y extents
locator(4)
```
